intro: Sideritis incana var. robusta, commonly known as the rough horehound, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is known for its fluffy, pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are hairy and grayish-green, contributing to its rugged appearance. Sideritis species are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
